info.title: PhotonIQ HyperSearch
info.description: API documentation for the PhotonIQ HyperSearch service

get.description: Get the current application health status.

get.summary: Get the list of available connectors
get.description:
Connectors define the _mechanism_ to access the documents.  Get the list of available connectors.
This list includes the name of the connector and the configuration properties required to connect to the data source.

get.summary: Get detailed information about a connector
get.description: Retrieve information about a connector, including its configuration properties.

get.summary: Get the list of available connections.

post.description:
Connections define the location of documents to be indexed.
They use _connectors_ to access documents and maintain the credentials needed to access that location.

get.summary: Get details of a connection including its configurations

get.description: Get the list of all indexes.

post.description:
An index is a bucket where all searchable documents are collected.
We support indexing text documents, JSON documents, and PDFs.  An index can be created in one of two ways: a lexical search index or a
semantic search index.

A lexical search index is based on the exact match of query terms or phrases within the text.  It operates on
the surface level, looking for specific sequences of characters or work forms without considering the deeper meaning of those words.
Use the *LexicalSearchIndex* schema in the REST API body to create a lexical search index.

A semantic search index goes beyond the exact match, aiming to understand the meaning and context of the query terms and documents.  It
seeks to interpret the intent behind a query and find conceptually related documents, even if they donâ€™t contain the exact query terms.
Use the *SemanticSearchIndex* schema in the REST API body to create a semantic search index.

get.description: Get details of an index. This will include the complete index configuration.

schema.title: Name of the index to fetch

parameters.name: index_name

schema.description: Name of the index to fetch.
schema.title: Index Name

parameters.description: Name of the index to fetch.

parameters.name: force

schema.title: Force delete
schema.description: This will try to delete all related resources ignoring intermediate errors.

parameters.description: This will try to delete all related resources ignoring intermediate errors.

get.description: Get the list of connections attached to the index.

delete.summary: Remove connection attached to the index
delete.description:
Remove a connection from the index.  This removes all the documents from the index that were added by the connection.
And this stops these documents from being indexed in the future.

post.description: Perform a search on an index.

schema.title: Name of the index to search

get.description: Get search suggestions for the current user.

enable.title: Enable
enable.description: Indicates whether to enable chunking. If set to `False`, chunking will be disabled, and other chunk configurations will be ignored.

max_characters.title: Max Characters
max_characters.description: Chunks elements text and text_as_html (if present) into chunks of length n characters (hard max)

multipage_sections.title: Multipage Sections
multipage_sections.description: If True, sections can span multiple pages.

combine_text_under_n_chars.title: Combine Text Under N Chars
combine_text_under_n_chars.description: Combines elements (for example a series of titles) until a section reaches a length of n characters. Defaults to `max_characters` which combines chunks whenever space allows.Specifying 0 for this argument suppresses combining of small chunks. Note this value is capped at the `new_after_n_chars` value since a value higher than that would not change this parameter's effect.

new_after_n_chars.title: New After N Chars
new_after_n_chars.description: Cuts off new sections once they reach a length of n characters (soft max). Defaults to `max_characters` when not specified, which effectively disables any soft window. Specifying 0 for this argument causes each element to appear in a chunk by itself (although an element with text longer than `max_characters` will be still be split into two or more chunks).

overlap.title: Overlap
overlap.description: Specifies the length of a string (`tail`) to be drawn from each chunk and prefixed to the next chunk as a context-preserving mechanism. By default, this only applies to split-chunks where an over sized element is divided into multiple chunks by text-splitting.

overlap_all.title: Overlap All
overlap_all.description: When `True`, apply overlap between 'normal' chunks formed from whole elements and not subject to text-splitting. Use this with caution as it entails a certain level of 'pollution' of otherwise clean semantic chunk boundaries.

enable.title: Enable
enable.description: Indicates whether to enable cleaning. If set to `False`, cleaning will be disabled, and other clean configurations will be ignored.

replace_unicode_quotes.title: Replace Unicode Quotes
replace_unicode_quotes.description: Whether to replace Unicode quotes with ASCII quotes.

bytes_string_to_string.title: Bytes String To String
bytes_string_to_string.description: Whether to convert bytes string to regular string.

clean_ordered_bullets.title: Clean Ordered Bullets
clean_ordered_bullets.description: Whether to clean ordered bullet points.

type.title: Type
type.description: The value type of the config.

display_name.title: Display Name
display_name.description: The display name of the config.

description.title: Description
description.description: A brief description of the config.

enable.title: Enable
enable.description: Indicates whether to enable extracting. If set to `False`, extracting will be disabled, and other extract configurations will be ignored.

logic.title: Logic
logic.description: JavaScript based data extracting function logic, accepting a `data` argument and returning either a JSON object or a string.Please note: The type of the `data` argument will depend on the ingested data. If the ingested data is structured (JSON or CSV), `data` will be a map/dictionary type. If the ingested data is unstructured (text, PDF, etc.), `data` will be an array of strings.

FlatIndexType.title: FlatIndexType
FlatIndexType.description:
A Flat index, also known as a brute-force index, involves comparing the query vector directly against
every vector in the dataset to find the most similar items. While this method is simple and can be very
accurate since it checks every possibility, it's also computationally expensive and slow, especially as
the dataset size grows. It is best suited for smaller datasets or scenarios where maximum accuracy is
required and computational resources or time are not limiting factors.

HnswIndexType.title: HnswIndexType
HnswIndexType.description:
Hierarchical Navigable Small World configuration is a graph-based index that constructs a multi-layered
graph where each layer represents a different granularity of the dataset. This structure allows for efficient
navigation and search within the graph by starting from the upper layers (with fewer, more general nodes) and
moving down to the more detailed layers until the closest items are found. Highly efficient for indexing and
searching in large datasets, offering a good trade-off between search accuracy and speed.

urls.title: Urls
urls.description: The urls of images for which to generate embeddings.

model_name.title: Model Name
model_name.description: The name of the model to use for generating embeddings.

n_lists.title: N Lists
n_lists.description: The number of partitions to use.

IvfIndexType.title: IvfIndexType
IvfIndexType.description:
In an Inverted File Index approach, the dataset is first partitioned into smaller clusters or groups using a
clustering algorithm like k-means. During a search, the query vector is first compared to the cluster centroids
to identify the clusters most likely to be clusters where similar items might be found, reducing the number
of comparisons needed. This approach is suitable for larger datasets where there is a need for a balance
between search speed and accuracy. It narrows down the search space to a few relevant items.

connections.title: Connections
connections.description: List of datasource connections to populate the index.

preprocessor.description: The preprocessing function and parameters for input data before adding data to the index.

facet_fields.title: Facet Fields
facet_fields.description: Facet fields are attributes or properties of documents in a dataset that can be used to categorize and filter search results. List of fields in the document applicable for filtering results.

sort_fields.title: Sort Fields
sort_fields.description:
List of fields in the document applicable for sorting results and direction. 
        Should be provided in `{ field_name: asc|desc }` format.  
        **Note: Setting index level sorting affects
        ranking and similarity score based ordering of search results.**

index_job_interval.title: Index Job Interval
index_job_interval.description: Set the time interval, in seconds, between each indexing job. Use 0 to index just once.

search_config.title: Search Config
search_config.description:
A dictionary of fields to search on and the analyzers to use.
    Analyzers enable you to break search inputs into sets of sub-values that search views
    can use to improve searching.  Should be provided in `{ field_name: analyzer_name }` format.  
    **NOTE: If this property is not provided for an index with structured documents, indexed
    documents are treated as unstructured documents. For unstructured documents ex: pdf, html,
    provide `{"content": <analyzer_name>}` in the dictionary.
    if not `{"content": "text_en"}` is assumed**

connections.description: List of datasource connections to populate the index.

preprocessor.description: The preprocessing function and parameters for input data before adding data to the index.

search_config.title: Search Config
search_config.description:
A dictionary of fields to search on and the analyzers to use.
    Analyzers enable you to break search inputs into sets of sub-values that search views
    can use to improve searching.  Should be provided in `{ field_name: analyzer_name }` format.  
    **NOTE: If this property is not provided for an index with structured documents, indexed
    documents are treated as unstructured documents. For unstructured documents ex: pdf, html,
    provide `{"content": <analyzer_name>}` in the dictionary.
    if not `{"content": "text_en"}` is assumed**

model_name.title: Model Name
model_name.description: The name of the model to use for generating embeddings.

text.title: Text
text.description: The text string for which to generate embedding.

image_url.title: Image Url
image_url.description: The url of image for which to generate embedding.

bits.title: Bits
bits.description: The number of output bits after quantization.

PqQuantization.title: PqQuantization
PqQuantization.description:
In Product quantization (PQ), the vector is divided into sub-vectors and then quantized independently.
This approach balances scalar quantization's simplicity and full vector quantization's effectiveness.
One of the most significant advantages of PQ is that it allows for direct fast-distance computation between
a query vector and the compressed vectors without needing to decompress the vectors.

operator.description:
The operator to use for filtering. Supported operators:  
* == equality
* != inequality
* < less than
* <= less or equal
* \> greater than
* \>= greater or equal
* IN test if a value is contained in an array
* NOT IN test if a value is not contained in an array
* LIKE tests if a string value matches a wild card pattern. Allowed wild card characters are '%' and '_'. This operator is case sensitive.
* =~ tests if a string value matches a regular expression
* !~ tests if a string value does not match a regular expression

condition.description: The logical operator to use for combining this filter with another filter.

connections.title: Connections
connections.description: List of datasource connections to populate the index.

boost.title: Boost
boost.description: Query to boost the results by. Results for `query` will be ranked to have more weight towards `boost`.

bury.title: Bury
bury.description: Query to bury the results by. Results for `query` will be ranked to have less weight towards `bury`.

language.title: Language
language.description: The language of the search query. Supported languages: en, es, de, sv, ru, zh, no, nl, it, fr, fi, pt

filters.title: Filters
filters.description: List of filters to apply to the search query.

projection.title: Projection
projection.description: List of fields in the document to return as part of search results.

distinct_results.title: Distinct Results
distinct_results.description: Chunked indexes will return multiple results for a single document. Setting this to `true` returns one result per document.

limit.title: Limit
limit.description: Maximum number of documents to be returned.

offset.title: Offset
offset.description: Number of documents to skip (used for pagination).

connections.title: Connections
connections.description: List of datasource connections to populate the index.

preprocessor.description: The preprocessing function and parameters for input data before adding data to the index.

facet_fields.title: Facet Fields
facet_fields.description: Facet fields are attributes or properties of documents in a dataset that can be used to categorize and filter search results. List of fields in the document applicable for filtering results.

sort_fields.title: Sort Fields
sort_fields.description:
List of fields in the document applicable for sorting results and direction. 
        Should be provided in `{ field_name: asc|desc }` format.  
        **Note: Setting index level sorting affects
        ranking and similarity score based ordering of search results.**

index_job_interval.title: Index Job Interval
index_job_interval.description: Set the time interval, in seconds, between each indexing job. Use 0 to index just once.

distance_type.description: The distance type defines the distance metrics or similarity metrics functions used to quantify the similarity or dissimilarity (distance) between two vectors. It is used to find approximate nearest neighbors when performing a search on an index.

indexed_fields.title: Indexed Fields
indexed_fields.description:
List of fields in the document to be indexed.  
    **NOTE: Make sure to provide this field when indexing structured docuements.**

model_name.title: Model Name
model_name.description: The name of the model to use for generating embeddings.

index_config.title: Index Config
index_config.description: Defines the indexing strategies to use to search items.

quantization_config.title: Quantization Config
quantization_config.description: Configure the precision of the numbers used to represent model parameters or embeddings. This technique maps continuous or high-precision values to smaller discrete values, effectively compressing the embeddings' size and reducing the memory and computational requirements for storing and processing them.

bits.title: Bits

SqQuantization.title: SqQuantization
SqQuantization.description:
In Scalar quantization (SC), each value is quantized independently, which is straightforward but may
not capture the correlations between the embeddings' different dimensions.

strings.title: Strings
strings.description: The text strings for which to generate embeddings.
examples: a man wearing a red hat

model_name.title: Model Name
model_name.description: The name of the model to use for generating embeddings.
